    • Method Detail

      • treatAsSet

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder treatAsSet​(com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor field)
        The elements of the given repeated field will be treated as a set for diffing purposes, so different orderings of the same elements will be considered equal. Elements which are present on both sides of the comparison but which have changed position will be reported with MessageDifferencer.ReportType.MOVED. Elements which only exist on one side or the other are reported with MessageDifferencer.ReportType.ADDED and MessageDifferencer.ReportType.DELETED regardless of their positions. MessageDifferencer.ReportType.MODIFIED is never used for this repeated field. If the only differences between the compared messages is that some fields have been moved, then MessageDifferencer.compare(com.google.protobuf.Message, com.google.protobuf.Message) will return true.

        If the scope of comparison is set to MessageDifferencer.Scope.PARTIAL, extra values added to repeated fields of the second message will not cause MessageDifferencer.compare(com.google.protobuf.Message, com.google.protobuf.Message) to return false.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the field is not repeated or is is already being as a map for comparison

      • treatAsMap

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder treatAsMap​(com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor field,
                                             com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor key)
        The elements of the given repeated field will be treated as a map for diffing purposes, with key being the map key. Thus, elements with the same key will be compared even if they do not appear at the same index. Differences are reported similarly to treatAsSet(com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor), except that MessageDifferencer.ReportType.MODIFIED is used to report elements with the same key but different values. Note that if an element is both moved and modified, only MessageDifferencer.ReportType.MODIFIED will be used. As with treatAsSet(com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor), if the only differences between the compared messages is that some fields have been moved, then MessageDifferencer.compare(com.google.protobuf.Message, com.google.protobuf.Message) will return true.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the field is not repeated, is not a message, is already being as a set for comparison, or is not a containing type of the key

      • treatAsMapWithMultipleFieldsAsKey

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder treatAsMapWithMultipleFieldsAsKey​(com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor field,
                                                                    java.util.List<com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor> keyFields)

      • treatAsMapUsingKeyComparator

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder treatAsMapUsingKeyComparator​(com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor field,
                                                               MessageDifferencer.MapKeyComparator keyComparator)

      • ignoreField

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder ignoreField​(com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor field)
        Indicates that any field with the given descriptor should be ignored for the purposes of comparing two messages. This applies to fields nested in the message structure as well as top level ones. When the MessageDifferencer encounters an ignored field, it is reported with MessageDifferencer.ReportType.IGNORED.

        The only place where the field's 'ignored' status is not applied is when it is being used as a key in a field passed to TreatAsMap or is one of the fields passed to TreatAsMapWithMultipleFieldsAsKey. In this case it is compared in key matching but after that it's ignored in value comparison.

      • addIgnoreCriteria

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder addIgnoreCriteria​(MessageDifferencer.IgnoreCriteria criterion)

      • setMessageFieldComparison

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder setMessageFieldComparison​(MessageDifferencer.MessageFieldComparison comparison)
        Sets the type of comparison that is used by the differencer when determining how to compare fields in messages.

      • setReportMatches

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder setReportMatches​(boolean reportMatches)
        Tells the differencer whether or not to report matches. Defaults to false.

      • setScope

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder setScope​(MessageDifferencer.Scope scope)
        Sets the scope of the comparison that is used by the differencer when determining which fields to compare between the messages. Defaults to MessageDifferencer.Scope.FULL.

      • setFloatComparison

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder setFloatComparison​(MessageDifferencer.FloatComparison comparison)
        Sets the type of comparison that is used by the differencer when comparing float (and double) fields in messages. Defaults to MessageDifferencer.FloatComparison.EXACT.

        If you use setFieldComparator(FieldComparator), this operation will be ignored

      • setFieldComparator

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder setFieldComparator​(MessageDifferencer.FieldComparator fieldComparator)
        Sets the MessageDifferencer.FieldComparator used to determine differences between protocol buffer fields. By default it's set to a MessageDifferencer.DefaultFieldComparator instance. Note that this method must be called before Compare for the comparator to be used.

      • setRepeatedFieldComparison

        public MessageDifferencer.Builder setRepeatedFieldComparison​(MessageDifferencer.RepeatedFieldComparison comparison)
        Sets the type of comparison for repeated field that is used by this differencer when compare repeated fields in messages. Defaults to MessageDifferencer.RepeatedFieldComparison.AS_LIST.

      • build

        public MessageDifferencer build()
        Creates a new immutable differencer instance from this builder.
